column2: CALIFORNIA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. As you drive on the freeway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column6: to signal all lane changes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 2. In areas with no pedestrian crosswalks or signals, pedestrians:
column4: should yield the right-of-way to vehicles before crossing.
column6: have the right-of-way over motor vehicles, but not over bicycles.
column8: should leave the curb as soon as possible to avoid being hit.

column2: 3. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: Blue indicates road user services.
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column8: They give directional information.

column2: 4. Yellow lines separate:
column4: traffic moving in opposite directions on a two-way road.
column6: traffic lanes on one-way streets.
column8: all carpool lanes from regular traffic lanes.

column2: 5. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.
column6: when following motorcycles.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 6. You are reaching an intersection, and trees block your view to the side for the last 100 feet before crossing. The intersection is considered:
column4: “open”
column6: “blind”
column8: “blocked”

column2: 7. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must turn around immediately.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 8. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column6: The first rain after a dry spell.
column8: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.

column2: 9. When sharing the road with a light rail vehicle:
column4: remember they are loud and move slowly like freight trains.
column6: always pass a light rail vehicle slowly on the right.
column8: never turn in front of an approaching light rail vehicle.

column2: 10. A flashing red light at an intersection means:
column4: Stop before entering.
column6: Slow down before entering.
column8: Stop and wait for the green light.

column2: 11. While driving, you should NOT:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead very closely.
column6: allow space between your vehicle and the vehicle ahead.
column8: scan the surroundings.

column2: 12. Alcohol:
column4: improves your reaction time.
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column8: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.

column2: 13. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column4: sharp turn
column6: no U-turn
column8: no left turn

column2: 14. If a passenger under 16 years of age is not wearing his/her seat belt, who may be cited?
column4: The driver
column6: The passenger
column8: The driver and all passenger

column2: 15. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: Yes.

column2: 16. On freezing, wet days, which of the following roadways is most likely to be slippery?
column4: Roadways on bridges and overpasses.
column6: Roadways near the top of hills.
column8: Country roads.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column4: Traffic signal ahead
column6: No traffic signal ahead
column8: Open intersection ahead

column2: 18. A vehicle suddenly “cuts” in front of you creating a hazard. Which of these actions should you take first?
column4: Honk and step on the brake firmly.
column6: Swerve into the lane next to you.
column8: Take your foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 19. You are stopped at an intersection. The traffic light just turned green. Should you go immediately?
column4: Yes, or you could be given a ticket for causing gridlock.
column6: No, because you must first wait 5 seconds before proceeding.
column8: Yes, but yield to any vehicle or person still in the intersection.

column2: 20. Warning signs normally are:
column4: triangles.
column6: diamond-shaped.
column8: rectangles.

column2: 21. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway ends ahead.
column6: Reversible lane ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 23. You are getting ready to make a right turn. You should:
column4: signal and turn immediately.
column6: stop before entering the right lane and let all other traffic go first.
column8: slow down or stop, if necessary, and then make the turn.

column2: 24. A flashing red light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: means the same thing as a stop sign.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 25. You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street only if:
column4: traffic on the street moves to the right.
column6: a sign permits the turn.
column8: traffic on the street moves to the left.

column2: 26. When you change lanes or merge into another lane, you:
column4: have the right-of-way.
column6: should first stop and check for cross traffic.
column8: need at least a 4-second traffic gap.

column2: 27. If there is a deep puddle in the road ahead, drivers should:
column4: steer their vehicle around the water, if possible.
column6: shift into neutral as they drive through the water.
column8: maintain their speed and make it through the water.

column2: 28. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 29. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column6: reduce traffic flow.
column8: encourage other drivers to do the same.

column2: 30. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: try to pass close behind.
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 31. A pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green. You should:
column4: proceed if the pedestrian is not in your lane.
column6: wait until the pedestrian has crossed in front of you before proceeding.
column8: proceed if you have the right-of-way.

column2: 32. You should stop before crossing railroad tracks:
column4: if your vehicle has three or more axles.
column6: any time a train may be approaching, whether or not you can see it.
column8: even when the railroad tracks are out-of-service.

column2: 33. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 34. When driving at night on a dimly lit street, you should:
column4: keep instument lights bright to be more visible to other drivers.
column6: turn on your high beam headlights to better see the vehicles directly ahead of you.
column8: drive slowly enough so you can stop within the area lighted by your headlights.

column2: 35. When coming to a curve or the top of a hill, you should:
column4: try and pass the vehicle ahead of you before entering the curve.
column6: increase your speed.
column8: not drive on the left side of the road.

column2: 36. What should drivers do when they see this sign?
column4: Make sure the bridge is clear of oncoming traffic before they cross.
column6: Look to the left and right for other traffic.
column8: Allow others to merge smoothly.
